{{short description|2015 film directed by S. Shankar}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox film | name = I | image = I film poster.jpg | alt = Theatrical poster | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[S. Shankar|Shankar]] | producer = [[Viswanathan Ravichandran|V Ravichandran]]
D. Ramesh Babu | writer = [[Subha (writers)|Subha]](Dialouge) | screenplay = Shankar | story = Shankar | starring = [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]]
[[Amy Jackson]]
[[Suresh Gopi]] | music = [[A. R. Rahman]] | cinematography = [[P. C. Sreeram]] | editing = [[Anthony (film editor)|Anthony]] | studio = [[Viswanathan Ravichandran|Aascar Film]] | distributor = Aascar Film
[[Global United Media]] (Kerala) | released = {{Film date|2015|01|14|df=y}} | runtime = 188 mins.[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Shankars-I-run-time-is-188-min/articleshow/45790432.cms Shankar's I run time is 188 min]. ''The Times of India''. 7 January 2015. Retrieved 7 January 2015 | country = India | language = Tamil | budget = {{Estimation}} {{INR}}100 crore{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/i-big-is-not-always-great-ians-tamil-movie-review-115011400828_1.html|title=Shankar's 'I': Big is not always great|work=[[Business Standard]]|date=14 January 2015}} | gross = {{Estimation}} {{INR}}240 crore world wide{{cite news|last1=Upadhyaya|first1=Prakash|title=SS Rajamouli's Baahubali to Ajith's Vedalam: The Top 10 Highest grossing Tamil movies in 2015|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/highest-grossing-tamil-movies-2015-top-10-films-that-kept-cash-registers-ringing-box-office-659394|accessdate=15 December 2015|work=International Business Times, India Edition|date=15 December 2015}} }} '''''I''''' is a 2015 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil]]-language film written and directed by [[S. Shankar]]. Produced and distributed by [[Viswanathan Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]] under his production company, Aascar Films, the film features [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]], [[Amy Jackson]] and [[Suresh Gopi]] in lead roles while [[Upen Patel]], [[N. Santhanam|Santhanam]] and [[Ramkumar Ganesan]] portray pivotal roles. The film tells the story of a body builder turned supermodel, played by Vikram, who after being deformed, exacts revenge upon those who were responsible for his predicament.{{cite news|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/i-vikram-takes-beauty-and-the-beast-to-another-level-ians-movie-review-rating-115011700464_1.html|title='I' – Vikram takes 'Beauty and The Beast' to another level (IANS Movie Review, Rating – ****)|agency=Indo-Asian News Service|date=17 January 2015|work=Business Standard}} The [[I (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] and film score were composed by [[A. R. Rahman]]. Production design was handled by [[T. Muthuraj]]. [[P. C. Sreeram]] was the film's cinematographer and editing was done by [[Anthony (film editor)|Anthony]]. The [[visual effects]] were designed by [[V. Srinivas Mohan]] through [[Rising Sun Pictures]]. [[Weta Workshop]] had worked on the digital and prosthetic make-up and background arts for the film. [[Principal photography]] commenced on 15 July 2012. The filming lasted for two years and eight months, during which shooting was done extensively in [[China]]. Further schedules were filmed in locations in [[Chennai]], [[Bangkok]], [[Jodhpur]], [[Kodaikanal]], [[Pollachi]], [[Bangalore]] and [[Mysore]]. The climax train fight scene was shot in the railway stations of [[Chengalpattu]], [[Odisha]] and [[Coastal Andhra|Vishakhapatnam]]. The film was dubbed and released in [[Telugu language|Telugu]] and [[Hindi]] along with the Tamil version.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/title-of-i-is-changed.html|title='I' will remain 'I'|work=Behindwoods|date=15 September 2014|accessdate=15 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915052911/http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/title-of-i-is-changed.html|archivedate=15 September 2014}}{{cite news|title=Vikram putting extra effort for Hindi dubbing of Movie I |url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2014/10/vikram-putting-extra-effort-for-hindi-dubbing-of-movie-i/|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=Indo-Asian News Service|publisher=news.biharprabha.com|date=12 October 2014}} ''I'' was released on 14 January 2015; Critics praised Vikram's performance, the technical aspects of the film - especially the costume design and makeup, and A.R. Rahman's soundtrack and score but criticised the 'wafer-thin' writing and screenplay and the film's 188 minute running time.[http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-15/blockbuster-is-the-word-now-for-i.html Blockbuster is the word now for 'I']. Behindwoods.com (16 February 2015). Retrieved on 2015-07-18. However, the film was a commercial success, grossing {{INRConvert|2.25|b}} worldwide, becoming the [[List of highest-grossing Indian films|fifth-highest grossing Tamil film]] and Vikram's highest-grossing film at the time. Vikram won the [[Filmfare Award for Best Actor – Tamil]] for the movie.http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Vikram-Nayan-take-home-Best-Actor-awards/articleshow/52821355.cms ==Plot== Lingesan ([[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]]) is a [[bodybuilder]] from [[Chennai]], whose main ambition is to become [[Mr India World|Mr. India]]. He wins the title of Mr. [[Tamil Nadu]], which gives him direct entry to the Mr. India pageant. He is [[infatuation|infatuated]] with Diya ([[Amy Jackson]]), a leading supermodel. Diya is soon blacklisted, with all her advertisement film contracts cancelled by John ([[Upen Patel]]), her co-star in all her advertisements, after she constantly rejected his sexual advances. To save her career, Diya decides to replace John with Lingesan, whom she had earlier met at one of her shoots, as her co-star for her next advertisement. The shooting is to take place in China at the same time when the Mr. India paegant is to take place, but Lingesan agrees, sacrificing his Mr. India ambitions in the process. Lingesan is given a makeover by Diya's stylist, a [[transgender]] woman Osma Jasmine (Ojas Rajani). The shoot initially does not go well as Lingesan is shy and awkward around Diya. On her director's advice, Diya pretends to fall in love with Lingesan so that he would loosen up and perform better during the shoot. The plan proves successful but Diya soon tells Lingesan the truth. Hurt, he focouses on modelling instead of her. They both gradually excel in the modelling industry as the lead pair. As time passes, Diya reciprocates Lingesan's love for her and they soon get engaged. In his journey from a bodybuilder to a top model, Lingesan makes many enemies, including John, whose modelling career was ruined due to Lingesan's rising popularity, forcing him to appear in local advertisements to stay afloat; Osma, who was [[infatuation|infatuated]] with Lingesan and revealed her feelings to him, only to be rejected; industrialist Indrakumar ([[Ramkumar Ganesan]]), whose company suffered losses when Lingesan refused to endorse their soft drink as it was reported to contain pesticides; and another bodybuilder Ravi (M. Kamaraj), who also competed for the Mr. Tamil Nadu title but lost to Lingesan. These four people conspire to take revenge on Lingesan and destroy his fame and modelling career. Two days before his wedding, Lingesan slowly starts to experience hair and teeth loss and a skin disorder. He consults his friend Vasudevan ([[Suresh Gopi]]), a doctor who is also the guardian of Diya's family. Vasudevan claims that he is suffering from a rare and incurable genetic disease which results in premature ageing. Lingesan's condition worsens, with his face and body [[Deformity|deforming]], and eventually he becomes a [[kyphosis|hunchback]]. In his current condition, Lingesan decides to disappear from public eye and also from Diya's life by [[Faked death|faking his death]] in a car accident. Only his friend Babu ([[N. Santhanam|Santhanam]]) and Vasudevan know that he is alive. Lingesan asks Vasudevan to marry Diya as he is the only person who will be able to understand Diya's past and present situation. Vasudevan agrees and the wedding is fixed. On the eve of Diya's wedding, another doctor named Thiruvengadam reveals to Lingesan that, contrary to Vasudevan's claims, he is actually suffering from H4N2 influenza, caused by the "[[Orthomyxoviridae|I]]" virus, which can only be transmitted by injection. He discovers that John, Osma, Indrakumar, Ravi and, to his horror, even Vasudevan, are responsible for injecting the virus into his body. Vasudevan had an [[Pedophilia|insatiable lust]] for Diya since she was ten years old and was enraged when she chose Lingesan over him. Therefore, he sided with Lingesan's enemies and planned the entire operation to have Lingesan injected with the virus. Enraged and betrayed, Lingesan abducts Diya on her wedding day and keeps her safely in an old house without revealing his identity to her. Aided by Babu, Lingesan starts taking revenge on those who had deformed him. He first immolates Ravi, who suffers severe [[burn]]s. He then prepares a paste which Osma unknowingly applies on her body, causing her body to [[Hypertrichosis|sprout huge growths of hair]]. Next, he subjects Indrakumar to [[bee sting]]s all over his body. He fights John over a moving train and gets him [[electrocution|electrocuted]]. Finally, he gets Vasudevan to unwittingly inject a virus into himself, causing his whole body to [[Elephantiasis|swell up]]. After achieving his revenge, Lingesan reveals his condition to Diya, who, though initially taken aback, still loves him despite his deformity. They decide to live a secluded life together. Lingesan undergoes [[Ayurveda|ayurvedic]] treatment, yoga and physiotherapy for his condition and soon returns to normal. ==Cast== {{multiple image | direction = vertical | width = 175 | footer = Vikram (Top) and Amy (Bottom) the principal cast of the film | image1 = Vikram.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = | image2 = Amy jackson.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = }} * [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]] as Lingesan ''"Lee"'', a bodybuilder who lives at local area and gets the opportunity to act in advertisement with a model named Diya * [[Amy Jackson]] as Diya, a famous model and Lingesan's love interest * [[Suresh Gopi]] as Dr. Vasudevan, Diya's family doctor and Lingesan's sponsor and friend who is later revealed as the main villain responsible for Lingesan's deformed condition. * [[Santhanam (actor)|Santhanam]] as Babu, Lingesan's sidekick * [[Upen Patel]] as John, a model who wants to sleep with Diya * [[Ramkumar Ganesan]] as Indrakumar, a businessman who promote Lingesan as a model * Ojas Rajani as Osma Jasmine, a famous stylist and a transgender * M. Kamaraj as Ravi, a bodybuilder who is against Lingesan * Mahru Sheikh as Diya's Mother * Azhagu as Lingesan's father * [[T. K. Kala]] as Lingesan's mother * [[Mohan Kapoor]] as Sushil, ad film director * [[Srinivasan (Tamil actor)|Srinivasan]] as Keerthivasan * [[Yogi Babu]] as Keerthivasan's fan * [[R. Sarathkumar]] in a cameo appearance as himself ==Production== ===Origin=== In an interview with the Tamil channel [[Sun TV (India)|Sun TV]], held shortly after the release of ''[[Enthiran]]'' in October 2010, the film's lead actor [[Rajinikanth]] revealed that [[S. Shankar|Shankar]], in 1996, following the release of his ''[[Indian (1996 film)|Indian]]'', had approached and pitched three storylines for him to consider for his next venture. Rajinikanth was impressed with two of the scripts and agreed to star in the films, which became ''[[Sivaji (film)|Sivaji]]'' (2007) and ''[[Enthiran]]'' (2010). The third script narrated by Shankar was centered on an aspiring bodybuilder who would later turn into a deformed hunchback following a freak accident. Rajinikanth was sceptical of it and refused it.{{cite AV media |people=Rajinikanth (Actor) |date=October 2010 |title=Super Star Rajini – Special Interview |medium=Interview |language=Tamil |location=Chennai |publisher=Sun TV}}{{efn|The claim was also backed by composer [[A. R. Rahman]] who, in the press meet held to unveil the film's Hindi version, disclosed to the media that Shankar had discussed the film with him almost 15 years ago.{{cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Xydogd7nXA |title='I' Movie: Hindi Audio Launch Event |medium=[[YouTube]] |time=2:15 |people=A. R. Rahman (Composer) |date=3 January 2015 |publisher=Bollywood Hardcore}}}} Following the release of ''[[Nanban (2012 film)|Nanban]]'' (2012), Shankar revived the project with [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]] in the lead. ===Development=== Shankar collaborated with writers [[Subha (writers)|Suresh and Balakrishnan]], to work on the script of his next film.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-11/news-interviews/31143321_1_shankar-nanban-new-team |title=Shankar to find a new team |date=11 March 2012 |accessdate=27 December 2013 |author=V. Lakshmi |work=[[The Times of India]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYCdVlQ9?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/news-interviews/Shankar-to-find-a-new-team/articleshow/12210265.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Music director [[A. R. Rahman]] was signed in to compose the soundtrack album and background score for the film, collaborating with Shankar for the tenth time.{{efn|A. R. Rahman and Shankar had previously collaborated for nine films: ''[[Gentleman (1993 film)|Gentleman]]'' (1993), ''[[Kadhalan]]'' (1994), ''[[Indian (1996 film)|Indian]]'' (1996), ''[[Jeans (film)|Jeans]]'' (1998), ''[[Mudhalvan]]'' (1999), ''[[Nayak (2001 Hindi film)|Nayak]]'' (2001), ''[[Boys (2003 film)|Boys]]'' (2003), ''[[Sivaji (film)|Sivaji]]'' (2007) and ''[[Enthiran]]'' (2010).}} [[P. C. Sreeram]] was confirmed to do the film's cinematography, collaborating with Shankar for the first time.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-22/news-interviews/32353376_1_tamil-alphabet-shankar-romantic-thriller |title=PC Sreeram in Shankar's next film |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=22 June 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYCow5iS?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/PC-Sreeram-in-Shankars-next-film/articleshow/14319729.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Action choreographer]] [[Peter Hein]] had to back out of the project due to commitments with [[S. S. Rajamouli]]'s film ''[[Baahubali: The Beginning|Baahubali]]'' (2015).{{cite web|author=V. Menon, Thinkal |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140607/entertainment-kollywood/article/i-wanted-work-ai-peter-hein |title=I wanted to work in 'Ai': Peter Hein |work=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |date=7 June 2014 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYCyaUmM?url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140607/entertainment-kollywood/article/i-wanted-work-ai-peter-hein |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} As a result, [[Stage combat|Martial arts choereographer]] [[Yuen Woo-ping]] was selected for handling the stunt sequences.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/I-and-the-Matrix/articleshow/17462717.cms |title='I' and the Matrix |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=3 December 2012 |accessdate=7 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYCzqMfl?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/I-and-the-Matrix/articleshow/17462717.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Additional stunt direction and supervision was done by [[Anal Arasu|Anl Arasu]]. VFX company [[Rising Sun Pictures]] under visual effects designer [[V. Srinivas Mohan]] was selected to provide the special effects in motion filming. Indian film production designer [[T. Muthuraj]] was confirmed as the film's art director.{{cite web|url=http://www.directorshankaronline.com/2012/06/%E2%80%98%E0%AE%90%E2%80%99/ |title=ஐ |publisher=S. Shankar Official Website |date=21 June 2012 |accessdate=24 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYD063fC?url=http://www.directorshankaronline.com/2012/06/%E2%80%98%E0%AE%90%E2%80%99/ |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In May 2012, Shankar visited [[New Zealand]] and met filmmaker [[Peter Jackson]] and [[Richard Taylor (filmmaker)|Richard Taylor]]'s special effects and prop company [[Weta Workshop]].{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-07-16/news-interviews/40612030_1_amy-jackson-p-c-sriram-shankar |title=Shankar opens up on 'Ai' |author=Prasad, Shiva |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=16 July 2013 |accessdate=30 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYAVTrn2?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Shankar-opens-up-on-Ai/articleshow/21098818.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Sean Foot and Davina Lamont provided the prosthetic makeup for [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]]'s [[Beast (Disney)|beast]] get-up in the film and additional [[prosthetic makeup]] was done by [[Christien Tinsley]] and Dominie Till.{{cite news|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-has-taken-technology-to-a-totally-different-level-in-ai.html |title="Shankar has taken technology to a totally different level in 'Ai'" – PC Sreeram |work=Behindwoods |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYDGB4LM?url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-has-taken-technology-to-a-totally-different-level-in-ai.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The film was earlier reported to be titled as either ''Thendral'' or ''Therdal'', but it was later confirmed that the project would be titled ''I''.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankar-vikram-to-team-up-for-thendral/257505-71-180.html |title=Shankar, Vikram to team up for 'Thendral' |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |date=16 May 2012 |accessdate=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYDGmrv8?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankar-vikram-to-team-up-for-thendral/257505-71-180.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Shankar-Vikram-Samantha-next-Project-named-as-I/articleshow/14358249.cms |title=Shankar, Vikram, Samantha next Project named as 'I' |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=23 June 2012 |accessdate=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYDHNFKE?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Shankar-Vikram-Samantha-next-Project-named-as-I/articleshow/14358249.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Gavin Miguel and Mary E. Vogt were in charge of the [[Costume designer|costume designing]] of the film's cast.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/shankar-s-ai-getting-ready-for-release-news-tamil-odykfkfdciesi.html|title=Shankar's 'Ai' getting ready for release|work=[[Sify]]|date=24 March 2014|accessdate=15 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915041358/http://www.sify.com/movies/shankar-s-ai-getting-ready-for-release-news-tamil-odykfkfdciesi.html|archivedate=15 September 2014}} According to Shankar, ''Azhagan'' and ''Aanazhagan'' were the alternate titles that were kept in mind, but since they were already used, he decided that a single alphabet would be the film's title. Since 'I' also meant beauty and explained the character of the protagonist, the alphabet was finalised to be the film's title.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/what-are-the-other-titles-for-i.html|title='I' isn't the first choice ...|work=Behindwoods|date=17 September 2014|accessdate=17 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140917060455/http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/what-are-the-other-titles-for-i.html|archivedate=17 September 2014}} In September 2014, producer and distributor Aascar V Ravichandran, stated the project would cost about {{INRConvert|2.2|b}},{{cite news|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/india-s-costliest-movie-i-to-be-released-in-10-000-screens-in-china-114091700951_1.html|title=India's costliest movie I to be released in 10,000 screens in China|last=TE Narasimhan|date=17 September 2014|work=[[Business Standard]]|accessdate=3 January 2015}} however by October 2014, he and director Shankar was widely quoted as stating the budget would be less than {{INRConvert|1|b}}.[http://ibnlive.in.com/news/director-shankar-hires-avatar-and-lotr-makeup-artistes-for-i/379794-71-180.html Director Shankar hires 'Avatar' make-up artistes for 'I' – IBNLive]. Ibnlive.in.com (19 March 2013). Retrieved on 2015-07-18.[http://www.ibtimes.co.in/i-release-vikram-starrer-clash-rajinikanths-lingaa-612648 'I' Release: Vikram Starrer to Clash with Rajinikanth's 'Lingaa'?]. Ibtimes.co.in (30 October 2014). Retrieved on 2015-07-18.[http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/an-exclusive-interview-with-director-shankar/article6491753.ece Shankar and I]. The Hindu (11 October 2014). Retrieved on 2015-07-18.[http://www.indiaglitz.com/the-budget-of-i-is-not-150-crorers--shankar-tamil-news-116504 The budget of I is not 150 crorers Shankar – Tamil Movie News]. Indiaglitz.com (15 October 2014). Retrieved on 2015-07-18. According to ''[[The Times of India]]'', Shankar opted for the title ''I'' as he thought it "explains all the characteristics of the protagonist"; the word has a variety of meanings, which include "king, beauty, astonishment, guru, vulnerability, owner and arrow".{{cite news | url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-09-03/news-interviews/41725095_1_moo-kv-anand-kaaviya-thalaivan | title=Kollywood filmmakers opt for classical words for film titles | work=[[The Times of India]] | date=3 September 2013 | accessdate=3 September 2013 | author=Ramanujam, Srinivasa | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140913053156/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Kollywood-filmmakers-opt-for-classical-words-for-film-titles/articleshow/22230095.cms?referral=PM | archivedate=13 September 2014}} ===Casting=== In April 2012, [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]] was selected to feature in the lead role.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/apr-12-04/shankar-vikram-26-04-12.html |title=Shankar's choice is Vikram |publisher=Behindwoods |date=26 April 2012 |accessdate=14 June 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYHKZ2ZQ?url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/apr-12-04/shankar-vikram-26-04-12.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Priyanka Chopra]] was initially reported to be in talks for the female lead.[http://www.ibnlive.com/news/vikram-and-asin-to-act-together-in-shankars-next-film-sources/259182-8.html Vikram and Asin to act together in Shankar's next film: Sources – IBNLive]. CNN-IBN.com (18 May 2012). Retrieved 15 April 2015. Later, [[Asin]]'s name was suggested along with Chopra.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Therdal-to-have-a-Bollywood-lead/articleshow/13381584.cms |title='Therdal' to have a Bollywood lead |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=22 May 2012 |accessdate=14 June 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYHOzwYn?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Therdal-to-have-a-Bollywood-lead/articleshow/13381584.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} It was reported that [[Deepika Padukone]] was also approached. Padukone denied her involvement in the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2012/deepika-padukone-not-doing-shankar-tamil-film-097722.html |title=I am not doing Shankar's Telugu film: Deepika Padukone |work=[[Oneindia.in|Oneindia Entertainment]] |author=Shekhar |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=13 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYHNTajf?url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2012/deepika-padukone-not-doing-shankar-tamil-film-097722.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} More than a week after the film's release, model-turned-actress [[Evelyn Sharma]] claimed that she auditioned for the role and eventually landed the role but opted out of it due to language barrier.{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/evelyn-sharma-was-offered-the-lead-in-i/article1-1310204.aspx |title=Evelyn Sharma was offered the lead in I |newspaper=Hindustan Times |agency=Indo-Asian News Service |date=24 January 2015}}{{cite news |url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/evelyn-sharma-was-offered-the-lead-in-i_1535238.html |title=Evelyn Sharma was offered the lead in 'I' |work=Zee News |agency=Indo-Asian News Service |date=24 January 2015}}[http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/evelyn-sharma-wants-to-work-in-tamil-cinema/article1-1309606.aspx Evelyn Sharma wants to work in Tamil cinema]. ''Hindustan Times''. (22 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. [[Samantha Ruth Prabhu]] was then signed on, but was forced to opt out citing date issues and health problem as the reasons.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Samantha-out-of-Shankars-film/articleshow/14466583.cms|title=Samantha out of Shankar's film|work=[[The Times of India]]|author=V. Lakshmi|date=29 June 2012|accessdate=11 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141003122722/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Samantha-out-of-Shankars-film/articleshow/14466583.cms|archivedate=3 October 2014 }} The role finally went to [[Amy Jackson]], who was paid {{INRConvert|7.5|m}} for acting in the film.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankar-signs-i-for-whooping-price/272679-71-180.html |title=Amy Jackson signs 'I' for a whooping price |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |date=21 July 2012 |accessdate=11 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYHs7ZAD?url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankar-signs-i-for-whooping-price/272679-71-180.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Santhanam (actor)|Santhanam]], [[Upen Patel]], Srinivasan{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-12-01/shankar-power-star-srinivasan-05-07-12.html |title=Shankar wants Powerstar |date=5 July 2012 |accessdate=5 July 2012 |publisher=Behindwoods |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJ71dyH?url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-12-01/shankar-power-star-srinivasan-05-07-12.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} and [[Suresh Gopi]] were selected to play the principal supporting characters in the film. [[Ramkumar Ganesan]], a leading film producer and the elder son of the late Tamil thespian [[Sivaji Ganesan]], was also added to the cast to play a pivotal role in the film.{{cite news | url= http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3613600.ece |title=Grand re-entry |work=[[The Hindu]] |author=Rangarajan, Malathi|date=7 July 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121130014256/http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3613600.ece| dead-url= yes |archivedate=30 November 2012}} [[Jiiva]] was considered for portraying the antagonist, but was unable to accept the offer due to his prior commitments.{{cite web|url=http://ssmusictheblog.blogspot.in/2014/01/why-jiiva-rejected-shankars-ai.html |title=Why Jiiva rejected Shankar's 'Ai'? |publisher=[[SS Music]] |date=29 January 2014 |accessdate=30 January 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJHJK1m?url=http://ssmusictheblog.blogspot.in/2014/01/why-jiiva-rejected-shankars-ai.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood]] actor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] was reported to play an award presenter for a brief scene. Ravichandran, however, denied the news, but said that he would appear in the audio launch of the film. To prepare for his role in ''I'', Vikram took some weight loss and gain tips from Arnold as well.{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140826/entertainment-kollywood/article/arnold-schwarzenegger-launch-telugu-movie-ai |title=Arnold Schwarzenegger to launch Telugu movie 'Ai'? |work=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |date=26 August 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJKZoVs?url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140826/entertainment-kollywood/article/arnold-schwarzenegger-launch-telugu-movie-ai |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Make-up artiste Ojas M. Rajani was reported to play the role of a [[transgender]] make-up artiste in the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140609/entertainment-kollywood/article/real-reel-all-happening-ai |title=Real to wwwreel, all happening in 'Ai' |work=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |date=9 June 2014 |author=Subramanian, Anupama |accessdate=10 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJL6WsO?url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140609/entertainment-kollywood/article/real-reel-all-happening-ai |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Mr. Asia Contest|Mr. Asia 2014]] Syed Siddiq appeared in the action sequences featuring Vikram.{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/bodybuilder-syed-siddiq-talks-about-winning-the-mr-asia-title/article6345040.ece|title=The champion quest|work=[[The Hindu]]|author=Achal, Ashwin|date=26 August 2014|accessdate=26 August 2014|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140826113431/http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/bodybuilder-syed-siddiq-talks-about-winning-the-mr-asia-title/article6345040.ece|dead-url=no|archivedate=26 August 2014}} ===Character looks=== [[File:Hunchbacked look of Vikram in I.jpg|thumb|Vikram's look for the film after the character is deformed]] In the film, [[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]] plays the character called 'Lingesan', who considers [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] as a role model and aspires to win the Mr. Tamil Nadu title. Shankar had crafted the hair style of Vikram by taking the front curl look of the younger Arnold Schwarzenegger as a reference.{{efn|name=fn1|American actor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], an inspiration to the film's main protagonist, launched the film's music.[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Arnold-Schwarzenegger-impressed-by-Vikram/articleshow/41004486.cms Arnold Schwarzenegger impressed by Vikram]. [[The Times of India]]. M. Suganth. August 28, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://cinemalead.com/news-id-exclusive-scoop-i-making-video-16-09-146058.htm|title=AN EXCLUSIVE SCOOP ON 'I' AND ITS MAKING VIDEO|work=Cinemalead|accessdate=17 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140917114416/http://cinemalead.com/news-id-exclusive-scoop-i-making-video-16-09-146058.htm|archivedate=17 September 2014}} As per director Shankar, among all get-ups in the film, the [[Kyphosis|hunchbacked man]] character was the most difficult one to sketch. Vikram was confirmed to sport his hunchbacked get-up in most parts of the film. The bubbles observed on the character's face were reported to be designed by [[Weta Workshop|Weta]]. [[Amy Jackson]] plays a model in the film. On casting and re-defining her looks Shankar was quoted saying, "I wanted someone who could authentically look like a model and then fixed Amy Jackson".{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140825/entertainment-tollywood/article/jackie-chan-and-arnold-schwarzenegger-set-south-gala |title=Jackie Chan and Arnold Schwarzenegger set for South gala |work=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYByRwlb?url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/140825/entertainment-tollywood/article/jackie-chan-and-arnold-schwarzenegger-set-south-gala |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Vikram also went bald for the film to change his looks in the film easier.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-talks-about-vikrams-character-in-ai-aka-i.html |title="Anything for 'Ai'"- Vikram |work=Behindwoods |date=24 March 2014 |accessdate=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYKi1kg5?url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-talks-about-vikrams-character-in-ai-aka-i.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Santhanam was also asked to lose some weight for his character.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/santhanam-goes-the-extra-mile-for-shankars-ai.html |title=Santhanam emulates Vikram for Shankar's 'Ai' |work=Behindwoods |date=21 January 2014 |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYKitu8M?url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/santhanam-goes-the-extra-mile-for-shankars-ai.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Peter Ming used actual cyclists in China for a cycle fight scene that was shot there.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Arnold-was-an-inspiration-for-Vikrams-character/articleshow/42637647.cms |title=Arnold was an inspiration for Vikram's character |author=M. Suganth |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=17 September 2014 |accessdate=17 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140917010442/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Arnold-was-an-inspiration-for-Vikrams-character/articleshow/42637647.cms |archivedate=17 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} ===Filming=== [[Principal photography]] officially commenced on 15 July 2012 accompanying a poster photo shoot that featured Vikram and Jackson.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-15/news-interviews/32684575_1_producers-puja-studio-green |title=Shankar's & Venkat Prabhu's films launched |work=[[The Times of India]] |author=M. Suganth |date=14 July 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJa4xgr?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Shankars-Venkat-Prabhus-films-launched/articleshow/14950245.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The first schedule of filming was completed in [[Chennai]] by early September 2012.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-24/news-interviews/32827443_1_deepika-tamil-films-priyanka |title=Priyanka or Deepika for Vikram? |author=Srinivasan, Lata |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=24 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJacYEj?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/news-interviews/Priyanka-or-Deepika-for-Vikram/articleshow/15117530.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The main cast and crew were off to [[China]] for a 50-day schedule to shoot certain stunt scenes while some song sequences were also filmed at locales in the northern part of the [[Hunan|Hunan province]]. The schedule in China was wrapped up by late November 2012.{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/regional/amy-jackson-takes-time-off-from-shoot-to-explore-china-608230 |title=Amy Jackson takes time off from shoot to explore China |publisher=[[NDTV|NDTV Movies]] |date=16 October 2012 |accessdate=16 October 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYJiwkAY?url=http://movies.ndtv.com/regional/amy-jackson-takes-time-off-from-shoot-to-explore-china-608230 |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/nov-12-05/vikram-shankar-29-11-12.html |title=Vikram's look in Shankar's 'I' |publisher=Behindwoods |date=29 November 2012 |accessdate=29 November 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYK0Ssvo?url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/nov-12-05/vikram-shankar-29-11-12.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In an interview with ''[[The Times of India]]'', one of the film's [[line producer]], Bill Chang was quoted saying, "We worked closely with S. Shankar for nearly fifty days in 2012, during which his film was shot in nine different locations. The range of locations available in China is simply mind-boggling. No other country in the world has such variety of locales ranging from colored mountains to futuristic city landscapes." Scenes in the song "Pookkalae Sattru Oyivedungal" were shot in [[Red Seabeach]] in [[Panjin]] and on [[Li River (Guangxi)|Li river]] in [[Guilin]].{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Chinese-temptation-for-Tollywood/articleshow/43161171.cms |title=Chinese temptation for Tollywood |first=Hemanth |last=Kumar |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=22 September 2014 |accessdate=23 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140923083219/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Chinese-temptation-for-Tollywood/articleshow/43161171.cms |archivedate=23 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In January 2013, a fight scene was filmed at an abandoned, 20-year-old factory in Chennai.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-01-21/news-and-interviews/36446431_1_suresh-gopi-dust-storm-vikram-and-amy-jackson |title=Shankar's 'I' leaves Suresh Gopi voiceless |author=Sidhardhan, Sanjith |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=19 January 2013 |accessdate=22 January 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYIFgLpx?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/malayalam/news-and-interviews/Shankars-I-leaves-Suresh-Gopi-voiceless/articleshow/18102210.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Sixty percent of the shooting was completed by the end of the same month.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-01-03/news-interviews/36129816_1_vikram-and-amy-jackson-thaandavam-shankar |title=Shankar's next with Vikram on fast track |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=3 January 2013 |accessdate=4 January 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYK0xaOV?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/telugu/news-interviews/Shankars-next-with-Vikram-on-fast-track/articleshow/17873389.cms?referral=PM |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite news|url=http://www.tamilsonglyrics.org/i-tamil-movie-songs-lyrics/ |title=I Tamil film songs lyrics |work=tamilsonglyrics |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VOpOj3MX?url=http://www.tamilsonglyrics.org/i-tamil-movie-songs-lyrics/ |archivedate=7 January 2015 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} By March 2013, four songs and three major action sequences were shot around [[China]], [[Bangkok]], [[Jodhpur]], [[Kodaikanal]], [[Pollachi]] and Chennai.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/ai-audio-launch-arnold-schwarzenegger-looking-forward-visit-india-video-608469 |title='Ai' Audio Launch: Arnold Schwarzenegger Looking Forward to Visit India [VIDEO] |work=[[International Business Times]] |date=6 September 2014 |accessdate=21 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Skssa32h?url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/ai-audio-launch-arnold-schwarzenegger-looking-forward-visit-india-video-608469 |archivedate=21 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In June 2013, a three-week filming schedule was completed in [[Bangalore]], [[Mysore]] and Chennai, and 75% of the shooting was completed by July 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/latest-on-shankars-ai-news-tamil-nhriSoiaeba.html |title=Latest on Shankar's 'Ai' |publisher=[[Sify]] |date=17 July 2013 |accessdate=12 August 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYDEpAz2?url=http://www.sify.com/movies/latest-on-shankars-ai-news-tamil-nhriSoiaeba.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Filming was almost wrapped up by March 2014, with just one song sequence and patch-work for the film remaining.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Vikram-Amy-Jackson-sizzle-in-Shankars-Ai/articleshow/33023795.cms|title=Vikram, Amy Jackson sizzle in Shankar's 'Ai'|work=[[The Times of India]]|author=Kumar, Hemanth|date=31 March 2014|accessdate=22 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140922005906/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Vikram-Amy-Jackson-sizzle-in-Shankars-Ai/articleshow/33023795.cms|archivedate=22 September 2014}} Shankar confirmed that the song would be shot after the film's audio launch. As per reports, a song of 5 minutes duration was shot for 40 days. For filming one of the songs, Vikram had gained a lot of weight of about 110 kg as he had to wear bulky costumes for the number.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/music/Vikram-puts-on-weight-for-Ai-song/articleshow/38807135.cms |title=Vikram puts on weight for 'Ai' song |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=20 July 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYKgnal6?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/music/Vikram-puts-on-weight-for-Ai-song/articleshow/38807135.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The remaining song sequence was filmed at [[Prasad Studios|Prasad labs]] in [[Vadapalani]], Chennai where a set was erected by Muthuraj.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/director-shankar-begins-shooting.html|title=Shankar begins shooting!|work=Behindwoods|date=18 September 2014|accessdate=18 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140918100445/http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/director-shankar-begins-shooting.html|archivedate=18 September 2014}} On 24 September 2014, Jackson confirmed that the shooting of the film was completed.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankars-i-completed.html|title=Finally, it's a WRAP for Vikram's 'I'|work=Behindwoods|date=25 September 2014|accessdate=25 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140925044206/http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankars-i-completed.html|archivedate=25 September 2014}} ===Post-production=== In February 2014, Vikram started dubbing for the first half of the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/vikram-starts-dubbing-for-ai-news-tamil-ocwqwWeaiehsi.html |title=Vikram starts dubbing for 'Ai' |work=[[Sify]] |date=22 February 2014 |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYDioHgQ?url=http://www.sify.com/movies/vikram-starts-dubbing-for-ai-news-tamil-ocwqwWeaiehsi.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} In March 2014, Vikram had completed his dubbing portions for the first half of the film.{{cite web|author=Ramchander |date=24 February 2014 |url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/shankar-summer-release-ai-dubbing-works-132703.html |title=Shankar's Summer Release: 'Ai' Dubbing Works In Full Swing |work=[[Oneindia.in|Oneindia Entertainment]] |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYE05fJQ?url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/shankar-summer-release-ai-dubbing-works-132703.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 3 April 2014, film critic and journalist Sreedhar Pillai stated that the film's trailer was in stages of editing.{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2014/shankar-ai-audio-trailer-launched-international-celebs-135683.html |title=Shankar's 'Ai' Audio/Trailer To Be Launched By International Celebs |author=Ramchander |publisher=[[Oneindia.in|Oneindia Entertainment]] |date=3 April 2014 |accessdate=3 April 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYE0jRNz?url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/shankar-ai-audio-trailer-launched-international-celebs-135683.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Patchwork and dubbing for the film was completed on 11 September 2014.{{cite news|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-confirms-shoot-for-ai-aka-i.html |title='I' pending ... confirmation from Shankar |publisher=Behindwoods |date=12 September 2014 |accessdate=12 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYE19MCL?url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/shankar-confirms-shoot-for-ai-aka-i.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} ==Music== [[File:Arnold Schwarzenegger February 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Actor Arnold Schwarzenegger, the inspiration of film main's character Lingesan, launched the music of the film.{{efn|name=fn1}}]] {{main|I (soundtrack)}} [[A. R. Rahman]] composed the [[soundtrack album]] and [[background music|background score]] for the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/regional/vikram-starrer-ai-now-has-a-new-name-i/article1-1262440.aspx |title=Vikram starrer 'Ai' now has a new name, 'I' |work=[[Hindustan Times]] |date=10 September 2014 |accessdate=11 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYFGVCzQ?url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/regional/vikram-starrer-ai-now-has-a-new-name-i/article1-1262440.aspx |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The music of the Tamil version was launched at the [[Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium (Chennai)|Nehru Indoor Stadium]] in [[Chennai]] on 15 September 2014.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Arnold-Jackie-Chan-come-together-for-Shankars-Ai/articleshow/40914556.cms |title=Arnold, Jackie Chan come together for Shankar's 'Ai' |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=26 August 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYFGtJL3?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Arnold-Jackie-Chan-come-together-for-Shankars-Ai/articleshow/40914556.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] was the Chief Guest.{{cite web|author=Ramchander |date=10 September 2014 |url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/count-down-begins-ai-audio-launch-158948.html |title=Count Down Begins For 'Ai' Audio Launch |work=[[Oneindia.in|Oneindia Entertainment]] |accessdate=11 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYFIIXLs?url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/count-down-begins-ai-audio-launch-158948.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The Hindi and Telugu versions of the soundtrack album were released on 29 and 30 December 2014, respectively. ==Release== ===Distribution=== Ravichandran earlier had stated that the film would be releasing on 23 October 2014 but the date was later pushed due to extensive post-production and dubbing works.{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/regional/vikrams-i-release-date-postponed-690371|title=Vikram's I Release Date Postponed?|work=NDTV Movies|date=8 November 2014|accessdate=2 December 2014}} The film is scheduled to release on 14 January 2015.{{cite web|title=It's Official: Shankar's 'I' on January 14|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/it-s-official-shankar-s-i-on-january-14-news-tamil-pbgjbmhabbjfe.html|work=Sify|date=6 January 2015}} It is stated that the film would be released in 3000 screens worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/vikram-is-embodiment-of-commitment-ravichandran-114082600177_1.html|title=Vikram is embodiment of commitment: Ravichandran|work=[[Business Standard]]|date=26 August 2014|accessdate=26 August 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826174550/http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/vikram-is-embodiment-of-commitment-ravichandran-114082600177_1.html|archivedate=26 August 2014 }} The film was planned to be released in [[Hindi]], [[Standard Chinese|Chinese]] and [[English language|English]] along with the Tamil and the dubbed Telugu versions.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Entertainment/Telugu/Music/Manoharuudu-audio-launch-on-Sept-15/articleshow/40868783.cms |title='Manoharuudu' audio launch on Sept 15 |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=25 August 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYFmBrNL?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Entertainment/Telugu/Music/Manoharuudu-audio-launch-on-Sept-15/articleshow/40868783.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The distribution rights for the dubbed Telugu version were purchased for {{INRConvert|300|m}} by Mega Super Good Films.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/confirmed-rajinikanth-join-arnold-schwarzenegger-i-audio-launch-608905 |title=Confirmed: Rajinikanth to Join Arnold Schwarzenegger for 'I' Audio Launch |work=[[International Business Times]] |author=Seshagiri, Sangeetha |date=12 September 2014 |accessdate=12 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYFfKk8k?url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/confirmed-rajinikanth-join-arnold-schwarzenegger-i-audio-launch-608905 |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/shankar-s-i-sold-for-record-amount-news-tamil-ojukI7ifbcfgf.html|title=Shankar's 'I' sold for record amount!|work=[[Sify]]|date=20 September 2014|accessdate=20 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140920084353/http://www.sify.com/movies/shankar-s-i-sold-for-record-amount-news-tamil-ojukI7ifbcfgf.html|archivedate=20 September 2014}} The theatrical rights in [[Tamil Nadu]] were sold to Sushma Cine Arts.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-creates-new-records-pre-release-business-609673|title=Vikram's 'I' Creates New Records in Pre-release Business|work=[[International Business Times]]|author=Seshagiri, Sangeetha|date=22 September 2014|accessdate=23 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140923021129/http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-creates-new-records-pre-release-business-609673|archivedate=23 September 2014}} ===Marketing=== The first look production poster of the film was unveiled on 15 July 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/shankar-vikrams-i-first-look--tamil-news-83785 |title=Shankar – Vikram's 'I' – First Look! |work=Indiaglitz |date=15 July 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGPfYaz?url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/shankar-vikrams-i-first-look--tamil-news-83785 |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Stills featuring the lead pair were released in March 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.moviecrow.com/News/4069/shankar-vikram-ai-new-stills |title=Shankar Vikram 'Ai' New stills |work=Moviecrow |date=31 March 2014 |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGQFmR3?url=http://www.moviecrow.com/News/4069/shankar-vikram-ai-new-stills |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|author=Ramchander |date=25 March 2014 |url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/vikram-shankar-ai-latest-photos-134966-pg1.html |title=Vikram-Shankar's 'Ai' Latest Photos |work=[[Oneindia.in|Oneindia Entertainment]] |accessdate=29 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGQmdRI?url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/news/2014/vikram-shankar-ai-latest-photos-134966-pg1.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The official motion poster teaser of the film was released on [[YouTube]] on 11 September 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-motion-poster-release-tonight-608868 |title=Vikram's 'I' Motion Poster Released [VIDEO] |work=[[International Business Times]] |author=Seshagiri, Sangeetha |date=12 September 2014 |accessdate=12 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGRLZ2X?url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-motion-poster-release-tonight-608868 |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The motion poster crossed 1 million views by the third day of its release.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/motion-poster-makes-the-cut-in-style.html|title='I’ does it in style|work=Behindwoods|date=15 September 2014|accessdate=15 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915113255/http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/motion-poster-makes-the-cut-in-style.html|archivedate=15 September 2014}} Two posters released on 12 September 2014, with J. Hurtado of ''[[Twitch Film]]'' labelling them as "out of this world".{{cite web|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2014/09/these-new-posters-for-shankar-and-vikrams-ai-are-out-of-this-world.html|title=These New Posters For Shankar And Vikram's 'AI' Are Out of This World|author=Hurtado, J. |work=[[Twitch Film]]|date=12 September 2014|accessdate=13 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140913093854/http://twitchfilm.com/2014/09/these-new-posters-for-shankar-and-vikrams-ai-are-out-of-this-world.html|archivedate=13 September 2014}} The producer screened a sneak preview of the teaser and the song "Ennodu Nee Irundhaal" for the critics in late August 2014. The teaser carried a dummy music score that was not composed by A. R. Rahman.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/the-unimaginable-50-second-ai-teaser-an-exclusive-review.html |title=The unimaginable 50-second Ai teaser – An exclusive sneak peek |work=Behindwoods |accessdate=6 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGzsQDH?url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/the-unimaginable-50-second-ai-teaser-an-exclusive-review.html |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The complete teaser trailer of the film was [[internet leak|leaked on the internet]] on 2 September 2014. Although the leaked teaser lacked decipherability, the person who had leaked the teaser openly informed the team about it and challenged them to take action against him. After further inquiries, it was revealed that the culprit broke into producer Ravichandran's office during the night and had copied the teaser. However, Ravichandran refused to make changes to the leaked teaser, and planned to release it as per the original schedule.{{cite web|author=Karthik, Janani |date=4 September 2014 |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Ai-makers-respond-to-the-leaked-teaser/articleshow/41632593.cms |title='Ai' makers respond to the leaked teaser |work=[[The Times of India]] |accessdate=4 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6SYGzgPFb?url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Ai-makers-respond-to-the-leaked-teaser/articleshow/41632593.cms |archivedate=13 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} The teaser was unveiled at the audio launch of the film.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Shankars-I-teaser/articleshow/42561789.cms |title=Shankar's 'I' teaser |work=[[The Times of India]] |date=16 September 2014 |accessdate=16 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140916002343/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/news/Shankars-I-teaser/articleshow/42561789.cms |archivedate=16 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Hurtado in his teaser review wrote, "We see Vikram taking on multiple characters including a Quasimodo-type, kicking monstrous amounts of ass in various action sequences, running across water, riding a cyborg motorcycle, and dancing up a storm in some absurdly colorful backgrounds." and concluded by saying "Shankar is nothing if not a visual stylist, and it looks like he's pulling out all the stops for this one."{{cite web|url=http://twitchfilm.com/2014/09/the-first-teaser-for-shankars-ai-will-be-the-most-spectacular-64-seconds-of-your-day.html |title=The First Teaser For Shankar's 'I' Will Be The Most Spectacular 64 Seconds of Your Day |work=[[Twitch Film]] |date=16 September 2014 |accessdate=16 September 2014 |author=Hurtado, J. |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ScgCFcwE?url=http://twitchfilm.com/2014/09/the-first-teaser-for-shankars-ai-will-be-the-most-spectacular-64-seconds-of-your-day.html |archivedate=16 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Prajakta Hebbar of ''[[CNN-IBN|IBNLive]]'' wrote, "When we heard that Tamil filmmaker Shankar was making a new film, we fully expected it to be larger-than-life, with a funky storyline and starring popular actors. But what we didn't expect was that feeling of thrill and intrigue.", asserting that "Vikram and Shankar have us hooked with the teaser.".{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankars-i-teaser-dissected-prepare-to-get-thrilled-by-vikram-who-features-as-two-beasts-and-two-heroes/499461-71-174.html|title=Shankar's 'I' teaser dissected: Prepare to get thrilled by Vikram, who features as two beasts and two heroes|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|author=Hebbar, Prajakta|date=18 September 2014|accessdate=18 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140918062526/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shankars-i-teaser-dissected-prepare-to-get-thrilled-by-vikram-who-features-as-two-beasts-and-two-heroes/499461-71-174.html|archivedate=18 September 2014}} Nivedita Mishra of the ''[[Hindustan Times]]'' elaborated in her teaser review, "Without doubt, the film's special effects are great by any standards. Now, whether or not, they have been indigenously put together or have been outsourced from the West, the producers alone will know, but just the desire to make a film that gets its production value right yet doesn't overdo it, is good enough. Here's hoping it will ignite a desire among Indians to go for the skies." and praised the spectacular landscapes, edgy camera angles, action sequences before concluding that "Shankar has put in a lot of effort to make this magnum opus worth a watch if teasers are to go by."{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/regional/teaser-review-vikram-s-part-werewolf-part-hunchback-avatar-in-i-will-stun-you/article1-1264728.aspx|title=Teaser review: Vikram impresses but will Indian audience take to hunchback's passion?|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|author=Mishra, Nivedita|date=18 September 2014|accessdate=18 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140918135058/http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/regional/teaser-review-vikram-s-part-werewolf-part-hunchback-avatar-in-i-will-stun-you/article1-1264728.aspx|archivedate=18 September 2014}} ''Behindwoods'' wrote, "Anyone who sees this remarkably impactful teaser would keep rewinding what he / she saw, to relive the experience over and over again." The teaser crossed 1 million views in just 12 hours of its release, making it the first [[Cinema of India|Indian]] film to do so, beating the record set by the teaser of the [[Bollywood]] film, ''[[Bang Bang!]]'' (2014), which crossed 1 million views in 13 hours.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-teaser-goes-viral-breaks-hrithiks-bang-bang-record-609184|title=Vikram's 'I' Teaser Goes Viral, Breaks Hrithik's 'Bang Bang' Record|work=[[International Business Times]]|author=Seshagiri, Sangeetha|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=16 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140916140109/http://www.ibtimes.co.in/vikrams-i-teaser-goes-viral-breaks-hrithiks-bang-bang-record-609184|archivedate=16 September 2014}} It reached 7 million views in 2 weeks after its release, becoming the only Tamil film to cross the mark till date.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/chiyaan-vikram-shankars-is-record-streak-continues.html|title=I's record streak continues...|work=Behindwoods|date=1 October 2014|accessdate=1 October 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141001053304/http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-14/chiyaan-vikram-shankars-is-record-streak-continues.html|archivedate=1 October 2014}} The film was promoted by Vikram on [[Bigg Boss 8]].[http://www.ibtimes.co.in/big-boss-8-vikram-shoots-special-episode-promote-i-salman-khans-show-618607 'Big Boss 8': Vikram Shoots Special Episode to Promote 'I' on Salman Khan's Show] Retrieved. 30 December 2014. ===Home media=== The media rights of the film were purchased by [[Jaya TV]] for {{INRConvert|200|m}}. The media rights included satellite rights and ringtones.{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/diwali-to-see-costliest-indian-film-release-114091600033_1.html|title=Diwali to see costliest Indian film release|work=[[Business Standard]]|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=17 September 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140921152129/http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/diwali-to-see-costliest-indian-film-release-114091600033_1.html|archivedate=21 September 2014 }} ==Reception== ===Critical response=== ''I'' received positive reviews from film critics who praised Vikram's and Amy Jackson's performances and technical aspects but criticised the script.[http://www.ibtimes.co.in/i-ai-movie-review-round-vikrams-outstanding-performance-makes-it-worth-watching-620306 'I' ('Ai') Movie Review Round-up: Vikram's Outstanding Performance Makes it Worth Watching]. ''International Business Times''. (14 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. [[Subhash K. Jha]] gave 4 stars out of 5 describing ''I'' as the "most exceptional" film from Shankar and wrote that it "takes us beyond the imaginable and the conceivable, fusing with fabulous flamboyance the fantasy element with a level of heightened reality that's commercial cinema's forte".[http://skjbollywoodnews.com/2015/01/movie-review/4125694.html I: Movie Review]. SKJBollywood News (16 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. Filmfare also gave it 4 stars out of 5, stating that "Shankar balances a social critique along with technical gimmickry and here the message centres about our obsession with physical perfection and beauty."[http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/movie-review-i-8218.html Movie Review:I]. Filmfare.com (16 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. [[Komal Nahta]] felt that Shankar's direction was "first rate" and wrote "His vision is unique and the translation of his vision on to the celluloid is brilliant. He has kept the narration so interesting that the viewer's eyes remain glued to the screen. He has given the film a huge canvas and has made it an audio-visual treat.[https://komalsreviews.wordpress.com/2015/01/16/i-dubbed/ I (Dubbed) | Komal Nahta's Blog]. Komalsreviews.wordpress.com (2015-01-16). Retrieved 2015-04-15. [[Rajeev Masand]] from ''[[IBN Live]]'' gave 3 out of 5 and wrote, "''I'' from visionary Tamil director Shankar is a work of staggering ambition, somewhat weighed down by the filmmaker's own indulgence...(it) may be far from perfect, but for the most part it's pretty entertaining stuff".[http://ibnlive.in.com/news/i-review-theres-a-lesson-in-i-for-makers-of-masala-movies/523300-71-174.html 'I' review: There's a lesson in I for makers of masala movies – IBNLive]. CNN-IBN.in.com. Retrieved 15 April 2015. ''[[The Times of India]]'' gave it 3.5 stars out of 5 and wrote, "Shot mesmerisingly by PC Sreeram on virgin locales in China and India, with world class CG work, this spectacle works because at the core, it's a romantic-thriller told simplistically....This is pure escapist fare but will resonate with those who read fairy tales at bedtime".[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movie-reviews/I/movie-review/45919364.cms I Movie Review, Trailer, & Show timings at Times of India]. ''The Times of India''. (16 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. ''[[Rediff]]'' gave 3.5 stars out of 5 and wrote, "The narrative lacks the pace; we usually associate with a Shankar's film. But he does tell a beautiful tale of love sullied by jealousies, greed and anger. The intriguing screenplay as the director alternates between the light-hearted past and the thrilling present keeps you engrossed".[http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-vikram-i-is-definitely-a-pongal-treat/20150114.htm Vikram's I is definitely a Pongal treat – Rediff.com Movies]. Rediff.com (14 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. ''Behindwoods.com'' rated the film 3 out of 5 and stated, "though the story is predictable beyond a point, it's an amalgamation of 'Masters' at play which works to a larger extent because of their huge efforts".{{cite news|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/i/i-review.html|title='I' Movie Review|work=Behindwoods|date=14 January 2015}} ''[[India Today]]'' rated the film 3 out of and wrote "It's not everyday you will get to watch a visually rich movie like this".{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/movie-review-watch-i-for-shankars-vision-&-vikrams-acting/1/413475.html |title=Movie review: Watch I for Shankar's vision & Vikram's acting |work=India Today |date=15 January 2015 |accessdate=25 January 2015}} ''[[The Hindu]]'' stated, "Vikram's terrific performance is let down by an uninspired, exhausting movie".{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/cinema-reviews/i-movie-review-by-baradwaj-rangan/article6789179.ece|title=Shankar's I Review|work=[[The Hindu]]|date=14 January 2015}} ''[[Daily News & Analysis]]'' gave the film 3 out of 5 stars, too, calling it a "great looking film but with shoddy writing and poorly sketched characters".{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/review-film-review-shankar-s-i-is-a-great-looking-film-but-with-shoddy-writing-and-poorly-sketched-characters-2053285|title=Shankar's 'I' is a great looking film but with shoddy writing and poorly sketched characters|publisher=Daily News & Analysis|date=17 January 2015}} Haricharan Pudipeddi, writing for ''[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]]'', rated the film 2 out of 5 and said, "All that's big may not necessarily be great. Hope Shankar realises that much better films can be made on a smaller canvas and much lower budget."{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/i-movie-review-1075|title=Shankar's I Movie Review|publisher=NDTV Movies|date=14 January 2015}} ''[[Sify]]'' wrote, "''I'' is definitely not the best of Shankar and he has to take the blame for poor writing. His story is predictable and there are no twists or scenes which keeps you engaged. Barring few eye-popping stunt scenes, a slew of beautiful unseen locations, breathtaking camera by PC Sreeram and few hummable songs by AR Rahman, ''I'' is very ordinary".[http://www.sify.com/movies/i-review-tamil-15058840.html Movie Review :]. Sify.com. Retrieved 15 April 2015. ''[[Deccan Chronicle]]'' gave the film 2.5 stars out of 5 and said, "While the movie and the effort is good technically, its content is just average".{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/150114/entertainment-movie-review/article/movie-review-%E2%80%98i%E2%80%99-shankars-directorial-fails-impress|title=Shankar's I fails to impress|work=Deccan Chronicle|date=14 January 2015}} ''[[Oneindia]]'' also rated the film 2.5 out of 5 saying, "For a movie which had so much of anticipation, ''I'' doesn't feed its audience enough to fulfill their expectations. The story is plain and doesn't look like a normal Shankar movie which would otherwise have interesting twists and turns."{{cite web|url=http://www.filmibeat.com/tamil/reviews/2015/i-movie-review-ai-review-vikrams-s-i-critics-fans-review-170469.html|title=I Movie Review: Plot Is Not Up To The Mark|publisher=Oneindia|date=14 January 2015}} Gautaman Bhaskaran, writing for ''[[The Hindustan Times]]'', rated the film two and a half stars, stating that Vikram's performance was the film's "only high point"; he noted that the film had similarities to the novel ''[[The Hunchback of Notre-Dame]]'' (1831) and the fairy tale ''[[Beauty and the Beast]]'' (1756), "without infusing any novelty into these age-old yarns."{{cite web | url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/reviews/i-review-vikram-cannot-salvage-this-tale-of-hunchback-and-beauty/article1-1306982.aspx# | title=I review: Vikram cannot salvage this tale of Hunchback and Beauty | work=Hindustan Times | date=15 January 2015 | accessdate=15 January 2015 | author=Gautaman Bhaskaran}} Deepanjana Pal from ''[[Firstpost]]'' wrote, "''I'' is too long, too stupid and too regressive to be entertaining" and also called it "superficial and the least fun Shankar film ever".[http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/review-vikram-stars-regressive-superficial-least-fun-shankar-film-ever-2049317.html I review: Vikram stars in a regressive, superficial and the least fun Shankar film ever]. Firstpost.com (16 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine's Ronnie Scheib wrote, "Shankar's visual ingenuity keeps things zippy for much of the hefty 188-minute running time, and star Chiyaan Vikram delivers a knockout three-pronged performance, but this cinematic bravura is offset by underdeveloped scripting, flatly one-dimensional villains and overdone lone-hero-vs.-swarms-of-murderous-attackers setpieces".[https://variety.com/2015/film/reviews/film-review-i-1201407492/ ‘I’ Review: Chiyaan Vikram's Triple-Threat Performance]. Variety (18 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. Rachel Saltz from ''[[The New York Times]]'' wrote, "''I'' is exuberant and unselfconscious but too cartoonish to engage your emotions. The onslaught of images and music will engage your senses, though, even as you're left giggling at the too-muchness of it all".Saltzjan, Rachel (14 January 2015) [https://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/15/movies/i-a-tamil-film-by-shankar-starring-vikram.html?_r=0 ‘I,’ a Tamil Film by Shankar, Starring Vikram]. ''The New York Times'' J Hurtado from ''[[Twitch Film]]'' wrote, "''I'' strains the boundaries of self-indulgence and modern tolerance in a way that has become something of a plague among Indian blockbusters. The film is amazing to look at, features a number of amazing set pieces, and some appropriately over the top action sequences, but even with everything including a few kitchen sinks thrown in, it may go on a bit too long for its own good".[http://twitchfilm.com/2015/01/review-shankars-i-a-tale-full-of-sound-and-fury-signifying-something.html Review: Shankar's I: A Tale Full Of Sound And Fury, Signifying... Something?]. TwitchFilm (15 January 2015). Retrieved 15 April 2015. ===Box office=== ====India==== According to [[Box Office India]], ''I'' earned around {{INRConvert|210|m}} nett in South India on its first day,{{cite web|url=http://boxofficeindia.com/Details/art_detail/iallindabusiness|title=I All India Business|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|date=18 January 2015}} setting records in Kerala and [[Telangana]]/[[Andhra Pradesh|AP]]. The film grossed over {{INRConvert|347|m}} worldwide on its opening day.{{cite web|url=http://ibtimes.co.in/i-box-office-collection-day-1-vikram-starrer-takes-excellent-openings-worldwide-listed-among-620491|title='I' Box Office: Vikram Starrer Takes Excellent Openings|work=[[International Business Times]]|date=15 January 2015}} The film went on to collect {{INRConvert|556|m}} nett in India in three days from all its versions. In its extended five-day weekend, the film earned {{INRConvert|950|m}} nett in India from all three versions, with the Hindi version netting {{INRConvert|75|m}}.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficeindia.com/Details/art_detail/ifourdaybusiness|title=I Four Day Business|publisher=Box Office India|date=20 January 2015}} The film grossed around {{INRConvert|1.84|b}} worldwide from all versions twelve days after its release.{{cite web|title='I' Mints ₹184 Crore in 12 Days in Worldwide Box Office Collections|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/i-mints-184-crore-12-days-worldwide-box-office-collections-621620|work=[[International Business Times]]|date=27 January 2015}} According to Andhra Box Office, the film had collected {{INRConvert|2.39|b}} worldwide and eventually became a commercial success.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/i/i-box-office-feb-01.html |title=I box office collection |publisher=Behindwoods |date=26 February 2015 |accessdate=21 July 2015}} The final domestic net(India net) collections were 1.36 billion. In crores final domestic net collections were 136, domestic gross 150 and worldwide 240 crores. ====Overseas==== ''I'' grossed US$697,346 in Tamil version and US$10,373 in dubbed Hindi version in USA in its first weekend.[http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/box-office/overseas/id/561 'I' scores over other releasesBox Office Overseas Report]. Bollywood Hungama. Retrieved on 18 July 2015. ''I''(Tamil) grossed US$201,207 and ''I''(Hindi) grossed US$4,009 in Canada in its first weekend. ''I''(Tamil) grossed US$258,764 in UK-Ireland in first weekend. ''I''(Tamil) grossed MYR 2,162,742 in Malaysia in first weekend. In first 10 days, ''I''(Tamil) grossed US$789,298 in USA, US$323,714 in Canada, MYR 3,146,295 in Malaysia.[http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/box-office/overseas/id/562 Baby shines; Dolly Ki Doli fails to impressBox Office Overseas Report]. Bollywood Hungama. 26 January 2015. In first 17 days, I(Tamil) grossed £386,542 in UK-Ireland and MYR 3,404,582 in Malaysia.[http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/box-office/overseas/id/563 Dull response for Hawaizaada, KhamoshiyanBox Office Overseas Report]. Bollywood Hungama. 2 February 2015. ===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Award ! Category ! Nominee ! Outcome ! {{tooltip|Ref.|References}} |- |rowspan="8"|

|[[Filmfare Award for Best Film – Tamil|Best Film]] |''I'' |{{nom}} |rowspan=8|http://www.filmfare.com/features/nominations-of-the-63rd-britannia-filmfare-awards-south-13750.html |- |[[Filmfare Award for Best Director – Tamil|Best Director]] |[[S. Shankar|Shankar]] |{{nom}} |- |[[Filmfare Award for Best Actor – Tamil|Best Actor]] |[[Vikram (actor)|Vikram]] |{{won}} |- |[[Filmfare Award for Best Music Director – Tamil|Best Music Director]] |[[A.
